notes: First-generation MX-5 Miata launched 1989 as 1990 model. Revolutionary affordable sports car that revived the roadster market. 1.6L engine 1990-1993, 1.8L from 1994+. Lightweight rear-wheel-drive with near 50/50 weight distribution. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mazda MX-5 article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Second-generation MX-5 Miata with updated styling and improved rigidity. More powerful 1.8L engine. 6-speed manual transmission available from 2001. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mazda MX-5 article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Third-generation RX-7 with sequential twin-turbo 13B rotary engine. Iconic sports car with pop-up headlights and sleek design. Sold in North America 1993-1995, continued in other markets until 2002. Very high difficulty modifier reflects twin-turbo rotary complexity, apex seal maintenance, sequential turbo system, oil injection system, and specialized compression testing requirements. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mazda RX-7 article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Second-generation Protegé compact sedan. Renamed from 323 in North American market. Available in sedan and hatchback body styles. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mazda Familia article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Third-generation Protegé compact sedan. Replaced by Mazda3 for 2004 model year. Multiple engine options depending on trim level. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mazda Familia article, December 19, 2024 revision.
Fourth-generation 626 midsize sedan. Available in sedan and hatchback body styles. Optional V6 engine on higher trims. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mazda Capella article, December 19, 2024 revision.
Fifth-generation 626 midsize sedan. Sedan body style only in this generation. Replaced by Mazda6 for 2003 model year. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mazda Capella article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Second-generation MX-6 sports coupe sharing platform with Ford Probe. Available with four-cylinder or V6 engines. Discontinued after 1997 model year. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mazda MX-6 article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Luxury sedan with unique Miller-cycle supercharged V6 engine on S trim. Positioned above 626 as flagship sedan. Difficulty modifier reflects Miller-cycle engine complexity and supercharger maintenance. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mazda Millenia article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Third-generation B-Series compact pickup truck based on Ford Ranger platform. Available in regular cab and extended cab configurations. Multiple engine options. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mazda B series article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Second-generation MPV minivan with car-based FWD platform. Replaced truck-based RWD first generation. Seating for up to seven passengers. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mazda MPV article, December 19, 2024 revision.
